title: Athletes return home with 11 medals
byline: The Sri Lanka athletics team, which concluded a successful tour by winning 11 medals at the Thailand Open Athletic Championship 2025, is scheduled to return to Sri Lanka today. The meet was held in Bangkok from June 21 to 25.

title: SL must go well beyond IMF programme: Prof. Sally
byline: Sri Lanka could miss a once-in-a-generation opportunity to plug into the fast-growing supply chains of southern India – that is unless the island nation pushes through market-opening reforms that go “well beyond” its current International Monetary Fund (IMF) programme, leading international economist Prof. Razeen Sally warned this week.

title: Hundreds of vehicles stranded as Sri Lanka Customs enforces decade-old import rule
byline: Hundreds of vehicles are stranded at the port, with hundreds more on the way, after Sri Lanka Customs abruptly halted the clearance of vehicles imported under cross-border Letters of Credit (LCs) starting May 26 , this year.

title: Nine DIGs, 16 SSPs among transferred senior Police officers
byline: Thirty-two senior police officers, including nine Deputy Inspectors General (DIGs) and 16 Senior Superintendents of Police (SSPs), have been transferred with immediate effect, the Police said.

title: Sri Lankan Kottu, Vatalappam added to Oxford English Dictionary
byline: Sri Lanka’s rich culinary and cultural heritage has received global recognition as several locally popular words have been officially added to the Oxford English Dictionary (OED) in its June 2025 update.

title: Solar power generators challenge tariff reduction in court
byline: A group of solar power generators has filed a writ petition before the Court of Appeal, challenging the government’s decision to reduce the tariff paid per unit of electricity generated by the rooftop solar panels.

title: Two youths attempting to flee to Italy with forged passports caught at BIA
byline: Two Sri Lankan youths attempting to travel to Italy using forged Indian passports were arrested by the Immigration and Emigration Border Surveillance Unit officials at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) last night.

title: Former Health Ministry Secretary arrested
byline: Former Health Ministry Secretary Janaka Chandragupta was arrested today by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) after providing a statement.

title: Bus fare revision to be announced following fuel price adjustment
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) says the annual bus fare revision will be announced after considering the fuel price revision scheduled for July 1.

title: Maj. Gen. Kapila Dolage appointed Army Chief of Staff
byline: Major General Kapila Dolage of the Corps of Sri Lanka Engineers has been appointed as the 67th Chief of Staff of the Sri Lanka Army, effective today (26 June 2025).

title: Indictments filed against Keheliya Rambukwella, 11 others
byline: The Attorney General today filed indictments before the High Court Trial-at-Bar in Colombo against former Minister of Health Keheliya Rambukwella and 11 others accused in connection with the investigation into the purchase of substandard human immunoglobulin.

title: Iranian Ambassador meets Vijitha
byline: The Ambassador of Iran Dr. Alireza Delkhosh called on Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath to brief him on the latest situation in the region.

title: Sri Lankan engineer Meriesha Fonseka joins Airbus Wichita Facility Team
byline: Airbus has spotlighted Meriesha Fonseka, a talented Sri Lankan engineer, as part of their single-aisle wing design team at the company’s Wichita Engineering Facility in the United States.

title: Mass shooting in gang-plagued Mexican state leaves 11 dead and more injured
byline: At least 11 people were killed, including a teenager, and more wounded in a Tuesday night shooting in the central Mexican city of Irapuato, authorities said on Wednesday.

title: Railway technicians launch 24-hour token strike over overtime pay issue
byline: Railway technicians and technician assistants launched a 24-hour token strike from 7.00 a.m. today (26) in protest over an unresolved overtime payment issue.

title: Salt imports cause delays as container backlog grows to 2,500
byline: Thr Sri Lanka Customs announced that delays are declining as daily container arrivals have risen from 1,200 to 2,500, mainly due to a spike in salt imports.

title: C.I.B. Big City fined Rs. 1 mn for selling bottled water exceeding controlled price
byline: A private business outlet in Maharaga (C.I.B. Big City) was fined Rs. 1 million by the Gangodawila Magistrate’s Court today for selling bottled water exceeding the controlled price.

title: Indictments filed against Keheliya Rambukwella and his family members
byline: The Bribery Commission filed indictments with 43 charges agianst former Media, Health and Environment Minister Keheliya Rambukwella and five other family members.

title: Plastic pellet spills growing environmental crisis for Sri Lanka
byline: Millions of plastic pellets continue to drift towards Sri Lankan shores following two shipwrecks that occurred off the southern and south-western coasts of India.

title: Ecuador’s most wanted drug lord captured in ’underground bunker’
byline: Police in Ecuador have recaptured the country’s most wanted fugitive, drug lord Adolfo Macías Villamar.

title: Salt prices to be regulated as imported stocks released to market
byline: The Sri Lanka Salt Manufacturers Association announced today that salt will be released to the market under new maximum retail price limits, in line with an agreement reached with the Consumer Affairs Council. The move comes as part of efforts to stabilize salt prices following the recent relaxation of import restrictions by the government.

title: Grade 13 student hospitalised after assault by teacher
byline: A Grade 13 student from the Ginigathhena National School was admitted to the Nawalapitiya District General Hospital following an alleged assault by his subject teacher, school authorities and police confirmed today (26).

title: Former Health Ministry secretary remanded
byline: Former Health Ministry Secretary Janaka Sri Chandragupta was ordered to be remanded until July 8 in connection with an ongoing investigation into the alleged accumulation of illicit assets, by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali Jayathunga.

title: CSE records all-time high with ASPI reaching 17,740.46 in a record-breaking performance
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed on a strong positive note today, recording a new all-time high in both intraday and closing levels of the All Share Price Index (ASPI), which settled at 17,740.46. The market witnessed heightened investor activity across all segments, including retail investors, high-net-worth individuals, and institutional participants.

title: UN Human rights chief urges domestic mechanism in line with international norms
byline: The visiting United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, Volker Türk, on Tuesday called for the establishment of a domestic mechanism to address human rights violations in Sri Lanka—one that adheres to international standards and principles.

title: UN Human rights Chief meets NPP leaders
byline: UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, Volker Türk met with the leaders of the National People’s Power (NPP) at the JVP headquarters in Battaramulla where they dscussed the repealing of the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) and look into the missing persons.

title: Govt. to import 40,000 MTs of Keeri Samba
byline: The Food Policy and Security Committee has recommended the import of 40,000 metric tonnes of substitute rice for Keeri Samba.

title: Supreme leader, in first appearance since ceasefire, says Iran would strike back if attacked
byline: Iran would respond to any future U.S. attack by striking American military bases in the Middle East, Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said on Thursday, in his first televised remarks since a ceasefire was reached between Iran and Israel.

title: New cargo flight service launched between Kunming and BIA
byline: A new cargo flight service between Kunming, China and Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) commenced operations with its maiden flight yesterday.

title: CMC PHIs withdraw from dengue control work for a week over exam dispute
byline: Chief Public Health Inspectors (PHIs) attached to the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) have decided to withdraw from the dengue eradication programmes within the CMC area for one week, following a dispute over the rejection of exam application.

title: Will Archchuna lose parliamentary seat?
byline: The Attorney General yesterday informed the Court of Appeal that Jaffna District Parliamentarian Dr. Ramanathan Archchuna continues to hold office as a public officer, raising serious threat to the principle of separation of powers.

title: Iran ready to increase imports from Sri Lanka amid Middle East tensions
byline: In the wake of the current Middle- East crisis sparked by a 12-day conflict between Iran and Israel involving the United States, Iran today expressed readiness to enhance trade relations with Sri Lanka, particularly in importing tea.

title: Bear blocks runway forcing flight cancellations at airport in Japan
byline: A bear roaming a runway at a Japanese airport forced staff to cancel flights and declare itself off-limits to passengers for the day.

title: U.S. embassy warns against birth tourism
byline: The U.S. Embassy in Colombo has issued a warning to Sri Lankan nationals and other foreign travellers, cautioning that those who travel to the United States on tourist visas with the intention of giving birth to secure U.S. citizenship for their child, risk being denied future visas.

title: 16 Sri Lankan youths heading to Japan for technical training
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) yesterday (25) awarded air tickets to a group of 16 Sri Lankan youths scheduled to travel to Japan under the Technical Intern Training Programme (TITP).

title: Registration for Israeli construction jobs opens tomorrow: SLBFE
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) announced that registration for three job categories in Israel’s construction sector will officially begin tomorrow (27). The closing date for applications is July 1.
